tasks.title: Initialize Next.js 14+ Project with TypeScript
tasks.description: Set up a new Next.js 14+ project with TypeScript, replacing the existing Vite and React Router setup.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new Next.js project with App Router:
```bash
npx create-next-app@latest . --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app --src-dir
```
2. Configure essential dependencies in package.json:
```json
{
  "dependencies": {
    "next": "^14.0.0",
    "react": "^18.3.0",
    "react-dom": "^18.3.0",
    "@prisma/client": "^5.0.0",
    "zod": "^3.22.0",
    "@tanstack/react-query": "^5.0.0",
    "next-themes": "^0.2.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "typescript": "^5.5.0",
    "@types/node": "^20.0.0",
    "@types/react": "^18.2.0",
    "@types/react-dom": "^18.2.0",
    "prisma": "^5.0.0",
    "eslint": "^8.0.0",
    "eslint-config-next": "^14.0.0",
    "prettier": "^3.0.0"
  }
}
```
3. Set up Next.js configuration in next.config.js:
```javascript
/** @type {import('next').NextConfig} */
const nextConfig = {
  reactStrictMode: true,
  swcMinify: true,
  experimental: {
    serverActions: true,
  },
};

module.exports = nextConfig;
```
4. Create basic folder structure according to App Router conventions:
```
/app
  /page.tsx
  /layout.tsx
  /api
/components
/lib
/public
```
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify the project builds without errors: `npm run build`
2. Ensure the development server starts correctly: `npm run dev`
3. Confirm TypeScript is properly configured by checking for type errors: `npx tsc --noEmit`
4. Validate that the App Router structure works by navigating to the home page in the browser
5. Test that the Next.js configuration is applied correctly by checking build output

tasks.title: Configure Code Quality Tools and Git Hooks
tasks.description: Set up ESLint, Prettier, Husky, and lint-staged for code quality enforcement and pre-commit hooks.
tasks.details:
1. Install additional dev dependencies:
```bash
npm install --save-dev husky lint-staged @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin @typescript-eslint/parser prettier-plugin-tailwindcss
```

2. Configure ESLint in `.eslintrc.js`:
```javascript
module.exports = {
  extends: ['next/core-web-vitals', 'plugin:@typescript-eslint/recommended'],
  parser: '@typescript-eslint/parser',
  plugins: ['@typescript-eslint'],
  rules: {
    '@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars': ['error', { argsIgnorePattern: '^_' }],
    'no-console': ['warn', { allow: ['warn', 'error'] }],
  },
};
```

3. Configure Prettier in `.prettierrc`:
```json
{
  "semi": true,
  "singleQuote": true,
  "tabWidth": 2,
  "trailingComma": "es5",
  "printWidth": 100,
  "plugins": ["prettier-plugin-tailwindcss"]
}
```

4. Set up Husky and lint-staged:
```bash
npx husky-init && npm install
npx husky add .husky/pre-commit "npx lint-staged"
```

5. Configure lint-staged in `package.json`:
```json
{
  "lint-staged": {
    "*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx}": [
      "eslint --fix",
      "prettier --write"
    ],
    "*.{json,css,md}": [
      "prettier --write"
    ]
  }
}
```

6. Add scripts to `package.json`:
```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "lint": "next lint",
    "lint:fix": "next lint --fix",
    "format": "prettier --write .",
    "type-check": "tsc --noEmit"
  }
}
```
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Run ESLint to verify configuration: `npm run lint`
2. Test Prettier formatting: `npm run format`
3. Verify TypeScript type checking: `npm run type-check`
4. Test Husky pre-commit hooks by making a commit with linting errors
5. Ensure lint-staged correctly processes staged files before commit

tasks.title: Set Up Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui Component Library
tasks.description: Configure Tailwind CSS with proper theming and integrate the shadcn/ui component library for consistent UI components.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify Tailwind CSS is working by applying utility classes to elements
2. Test dark mode functionality with the theme provider
3. Install and test several shadcn/ui components to ensure they render correctly
4. Verify responsive design works across different viewport sizes
5. Test that the theme persists across page refreshes
6. Validate that custom CSS variables are applied correctly to components

tasks.title: Implement Prisma ORM Integration
tasks.description: Set up Prisma ORM with the initial database schema, migrations, and client configuration for type-safe database operations.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify Prisma schema compiles without errors: `npx prisma validate`
2. Test database connection: `npx prisma db pull`
3. Run migrations to ensure they apply correctly: `npx prisma migrate dev`
4. Test seeding functionality: `npx prisma db seed`
5. Create a simple script to query the database and verify type safety
6. Verify that Prisma Client is properly instantiated in the application
7. Test database operations in a development environment

tasks.title: Create Core Layout and UI Components
tasks.description: Implement the core layout structure and essential UI components following the App Router architecture.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify all components render correctly without errors
2. Test responsive design across different viewport sizes
3. Ensure theme toggle functionality works correctly
4. Validate navigation links work properly
5. Test layout components with different content sizes
6. Verify proper nesting of layout components
7. Check accessibility of all UI components using tools like Lighthouse

tasks.title: Implement Next.js API Routes with Prisma Integration
tasks.description: Create type-safe API routes using the App Router's route handlers with Prisma integration for database operations.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test each API endpoint with valid requests to ensure proper responses
2. Test error handling with invalid requests
3. Verify pagination works correctly in list endpoints
4. Test CRUD operations against a test database
5. Verify middleware correctly applies CORS headers
6. Test API utility functions with mock responses
7. Validate type safety of API responses
8. Test performance with larger datasets

tasks.title: Implement Authentication with NextAuth.js
tasks.description: Set up authentication using NextAuth.js with Prisma adapter, including login/signup flows and protected routes.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test user registration and login flows
2. Verify session persistence across page refreshes
3. Test protected routes with authenticated and unauthenticated users
4. Verify error handling for invalid credentials
5. Test password hashing and comparison
6. Verify JWT token generation and validation
7. Test sign-out functionality
8. Validate that user data is properly stored in the database

tasks.title: Implement Optional Express Backend Integration
tasks.description: Create a separate Express backend with Prisma integration that can be used as an alternative to Next.js API routes.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test Express server startup and connection
2. Verify API endpoints match the Next.js API routes
3. Test CRUD operations against a test database
4. Verify error handling and rate limiting
5. Test integration between Next.js frontend and Express backend
6. Validate shared types between both systems
7. Test performance and scalability
8. Verify environment configuration works correctly

tasks.title: Implement Client-Side Data Fetching with React Query
tasks.description: Set up React Query for client-side data fetching, caching, and state management with TypeScript integration.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test React Query hooks with mock API responses
2. Verify data fetching, caching, and invalidation
3. Test optimistic updates and error handling
4. Verify pagination works correctly
5. Test form submission and data mutations
6. Validate that the React Query DevTools are working
7. Test performance with larger datasets
8. Verify TypeScript integration and type safety

tasks.title: Create Documentation and Example Pages
tasks.description: Develop comprehensive documentation and example pages showcasing different rendering strategies, API usage, and component patterns.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify all example pages render correctly without errors
2. Test documentation accuracy by following the setup instructions
3. Validate that all rendering strategies work as described
4. Test form validation and submission in the form example
5. Verify that the README contains all necessary information
6. Test navigation between example pages
7. Validate code snippets in the documentation
8. Ensure all examples are accessible and responsive
